   (c)    Rules Governing the Determination of Number of Spaces. In computing
the number of spaces required in subsection (b) of this section, the following
rules shall govern:
      (1)    "Floor area" means the usable floor area of the specified
business.
      (2)    Where fractional spaces result, the parking spaces required shall
be construed to be the nearest whole number.
      (3)    The parking space requirement for a use not specifically mentioned
herein shall be the same as required for a use of similar nature.
      (4)    Whenever a building or use constructed or established after the
effective date of this Zoning Ordinance is changed or enlarged in floor area,
number of employees, number of dwelling units, seating capacity or otherwise,
to create a need for an increase of ten percent or more in the number of
existing parking spaces, such spaces shall be provided on the basis of the
enlargement or change.
         (Ord. 34-17. Passed 11-20-17.)
   1155.03 SPECIAL PARKING PROVISIONS.
   (a)    The parking of disabled vehicles within a residential district for a
period of more than one week shall be prohibited, except that such vehicles may
be stored in an enclosed garage or other accessory building, provided that no
business shall be conducted in connection therewith while such vehicles are
parked or stored.
   (b)    All parking spaces required herein shall be located on the same lot
with the building or use served. Where possible, however, the required space
may be located not to exceed 500 feet away from the use being served.
   (c)    Not more than fifty percent of the parking spaces required for (1)
theaters, bowling alleys, dance halls, night clubs or cafes, and up to one
hundred percent of the parking spaces required for a church or school
auditorium, may be provided and used jointly by (2) banks, offices, retail
stores, repair shops, service establishments and similar uses not normally
open, used or operated during the same hours as those listed in (1), provided
however, that acceptable agreement thereto is made as specified in subsection
(d) hereof.
   (d)    In any case where the required parking spaces are not located on the
same lot with the building or use served, or where such spaces are collectively
or jointly provided and used, a written agreement thereby assuring their
retention for such purposes, shall be properly drawn and executed by the
parties concerned, approved as to form by the Solicitor and executed by Council
and shall be filed with the application for a building permit. Where written
agreements are not feasible, Council may make exceptions.
(Ord. 40-63. Passed 12-12-63.)
   1155.04 DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF PARKING AREAS.
   Every parcel of land hereafter used as a public, commercial or private
parking area shall be developed and maintained in accordance with the following
requirements.
   (a)    Screening and Landscaping. Off-street parking areas for more than ten
vehicles shall be effectively screened on each side which adjoins or faces
premises situated in any "R" District, or institutional premises by a masonry
wall or solid fence of acceptable design. Such wall or fence shall be not less
than four feet or more than six feet in height and shall be maintained in good
condition without any advertising thereon. The space between such wall or fence
and the lot line of the adjoining premises in any "R" District shall be
landscaped with grass, hardy shrubs or evergreen ground cover and maintained in
good condition. In lieu of such wall or fence, a strip of land not less than
fifteen feet in width, and planted and maintained with an evergreen hedge or
dense planting of evergreen shrubs not less than four feet in height may be
substituted.
   (b)    Minimum Distance and Setbacks. No part of any parking area for more
than twenty vehicles shall be closer than twenty feet to any dwelling, school,
hospital or other institution for human care located on an adjoining lot,
unless screened by an unpierced masonry wall of acceptable design. If on the
same lot with a main building, the parking area shall not be located within the
front yard required for such building. In no case shall any part of a parking
area be closer than five feet to any established street or alley right of way.
The wall or hedge required in subsection (a) hereof shall be set back from each
street, the same as if it were a building wall, so as to observe the front yard
requirements of this Zoning Ordinance.
   (c)    Surfacing. Any off-street parking area for more than ten vehicles
shall be graded for proper drainage and surfaced so as to provide a durable and
dustless surface, and shall be so arranged and marked as to provide for orderly
and safe parking and storage of vehicles. The foregoing surfacing requirements
shall not apply to a parking area in an "M" District if more than 200 feet
distant from any "R" District, except that a dustless surface shall be provided
in any case.
   (d)    Lighting. Any lighting used to illuminate any off-street parking area
shall be so arranged as to reflect the light away from adjoining premises in
any "R" District.
      (Ord. 40-63. Passed 12-12-63; Ord. 02-08. Passed 2-18-08.)
APPENDIX
Summary of Procedure for Obtaining Zoning Certificate
ORDINARY CONDITIONS.
Step I    Landowner submits request for Zoning Certificate to Administrative
Officer.
Step II   Administrative Officer reviews proposed use of land or buildings to
determine whether it conforms with the Zoning Ordinance.
   (a)    If it complies with the Zoning Ordinance, issues Zoning Certificate
and landowner proceeds.
   (b)    If it does not comply, states reason and denies Zoning Certificate.
      Landowner may then:
      (1)    Change proposal to conform to regulations and reapply.
      (2)    Appeal the specific case to Board of Zoning Appeals.
      (3)    Request a zone change be considered by Planning Commission.
CONDITIONAL USES AND EXCEPTIONAL CONDITIONS.
Board of Zoning Appeals rules on items listed as conditional uses in the Zoning
Ordinance and on exceptions and variations as specified in the Zoning
Ordinance.
PROPOSED ZONING CHANGES.
Planning Commission:
   (a)    Reviews all proposed Zoning District Map and Ordinance changes and
recommends action to Council.
   (b)    Council reviews recommendations and holds public hearing.
    (c)    Council grants or denies change.
(Ord. 40-63. Passed 12-12-63.)

1301.01 ADOPTION.
   Ohio Administrative Code (OAC) 4101:8 Board of Building Standards:
Residential Code of Ohio as it exists and as amended in the future is adopted
as the standard that will be applied by the city of Dover. The link for those
standards is http://codes.ohio.gov/oac/4101%3A8 and shall be used for Dover
residential standards and enforcement. The Ohio Building Code (OBC) as adopted
and as amended in the future and presently found in chapter 35 of the OBC is
adopted as the electrical code of the city of Dover and OBC chapter 29 as
adopted and amended in the future is adopted as the plumbing code of the city
of Dover.
(Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)

registered in the building trades shall comply with state codes regarding
construction in the city of Dover.

1301.03 DEFINITIONS.
   (a)    Wherever the word "Municipality" is used in the National Building
Code, it means the City of Dover.
   (b)    Wherever the term "corporation council" is used in the National
Building Code, it means the Law Director of the City of Dover.
   (c)    Wherever the term "Building Official" is used in the National
Building Code, it means the Building and Zoning Codes Administrator of the City
of Dover or his authorized representative.
   (d)    Wherever the term "Board of Appeals" is used in the National Building
Code, it means the Board of Zoning and Housing Appeals as set forth in Section
 1327.16 hereof.
(Ord. 47-79. Passed 11-19-79; Ord. 39-07. Passed 5-30-07.)
1301.04 BUILDING AND ZONING CODES ADMINISTRATOR; POWERS AND DUTIES.
   (a)    There is hereby created the position of Building and Zoning Codes
Administrator. The Building and Zoning Codes Administrator shall be considered
an employee of the City, and shall be appointed by the City Council. The
Building and Zoning Codes Administrator shall be in the classified service of
the Municipal Civil Service and subject to the rules and regulations of the
Municipal Civil Service Commission and the statutes of Ohio relating to Civil
Service, except that the first appointment hereunder shall be made without the
necessity of competitive examination.
   (b)   It shall be the duty of the Building and Zoning Codes Administrator
(hereinafter in Chapter 1300 and where applicable in the DCO as Administrator)
to enforce the duties as assigned by Part 13, Chapter 1300 and Part 11, Chapter
1100 of the DCO. He shall issue registrations and certificates where
permissible under the provisions of the DCO within the framework of the Ohio
Revised Code (ORC) and the Ohio Administrative Code (OAC).
   (c)    The Building and Zoning Codes Administrator shall have the power to
order all work stopped on construction or alteration or repair of buildings in
the City when such work is being done in violation of any provision of any
ordinance relating thereto, or in violation of the Zoning Ordinance. Work shall
not be resumed after the issuance of such an order except on the written
permission of the Inspector, provided, that if the stop order is an oral one,
it shall be followed by a written stop order within an hour. Such written stop
order may be served by the Inspector or any Policeman.
   (d)   As a term and condition of the issuance of a certificate or
registration, the person receiving the certificate or registration grants to
the Building and Zoning Codes Administrator the right to make or cause to be
made an entry into any building or premises where the work of altering,
repairing or constructing any building or structure is going on, for the
purpose of making inspections at any reasonable hour.
   (e)    The Building and Zoning Codes Administrator shall be considered an
employee of the Department of Public Service and be under the supervision of
the Director of Public Service; and shall be subject to and entitled to all the
present rights, privileges and benefits according to the other City employees.
   (f)    The salary of the Building and Zoning Codes Administrator shall be as
set by ordinance payable bi-weekly. The work week shall be forty (40) hours and
for all overtime worked, the Inspector shall be granted compensating time off.
   (g)    The Building and Zoning Codes Administrator shall be furnished a
means of travel by the City in order to perform his duties as Building and
Zoning Codes Administrator, and until such time as a vehicle is provided and
during the time that such employee uses his own vehicle, he shall be paid and
reimbursed a mileage allowance as provided by ordinance.
(Ord. 21-67. Passed 3-6-67; Ord. 39-07. Passed 5-30-07; Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-
14.)

1305.01 PLUMBING REGULATIONS.
   The following regulations shall govern buildings not specifically governed
by the Ohio Plumbing Code:
   (a)    General. Every building in which plumbing fixtures are installed
shall have at least one three-inch stack extending full size through the roof.
All vents protruding through the roof shall be at least three inches in
diameter and shall extend at least six inches above the roof. Change in
diameter shall be made by means of an increaser below the roof.
   The vent pipe must terminate at least five feet from any window or door.
   Vent pipe two and one-half inches in diameter or smaller shall rise a
minimum of forty-five degrees to above the crown of the soil or waste pipe
before turning horizontal, but in no case shall the vent pipe be connected to
the main stack until it has risen at least two inches above the highest
fixture. Vent pipes three inches in diameter or larger need not rise on a
forty-five degree angle, but will be run with as much slope as is possible
toward the stack and shall rise vertical as soon as possible, so as not to be
unduly exposed to back water and splash waste. Where reduction occurs in vent
pipes, it shall be made with the proper reduced fittings and face bushings. No
unions shall be permitted in the construction of any waste or vent pipes.
   Water closets, when located in the basement, need not be back vented when
located not more than six feet from a sewer carrying waste from a vented
fixture. Basement floor drains having a four-inch trap, when used as a shower
drain, need not be back vented.
   (b)    Building Drains. All inside sewering shall be known as the building
drain and shall be constructed of standard weight soil pipe or of salt glazed
vitrified terracotta premium joint pipe or extra heavy cast-iron pipe with
leaded calked joints, In the event that salt glazed vitrified terracotta
premium joint pipe is used as a building drain, it shall be at least four
inches in diameter. Upon immediately entering the basement, there shall be
installed a four-inch Y fitting, The opening shall be extended up to the
basement floor and shall be properly cemented and left for future use as a
cleanout.
   (c)    Building Sewer.
      (1)    That part of the house sewer that extends from the City main sewer
within three feet of the foundation shall be known as the building sewer and
shall not be less than four inches in diameter.
      (2)    No private sewage disposal system shall be installed or maintained
on property accessible to a sanitary sewer.
      (3)    No private sewage disposal system shall be installed until the
location and the proposed methods of construction therefor have been approved
by the Plumbing Inspector. Installation and construction of all private sewage
disposal systems, systems, equipment and devices shall conform to the
recommendation of the Ohio EPA.
   (d)    Material Permitted in Stack, Waste and Vent Pipes.
      (1)    Soil stacks may be constructed of standard weight cast-iron pipe,
type "M" copper or galvanized pipe.
      (2)    Waste lines may be constructed of standard weight cast-iron pipe,
type "M" copper or galvanized pipe.
      (3)    All fittings used in waste lines shall be of drainage type
constructed of galvanized steel, brass, copper or tarred cast-iron soil
fittings.
      (4)    All fittings used in vent lines need to be of drainage type but
shall be constructed of the same materials as those permitted in the
construction of waste lines.
   (e)    Water Service Pipe. All water piping from the City mains shall be
three-fourths type "K" soft copper with flared fittings extending to the
property lines at which point a curb stop shall be installed after which three-
fourths inch type "K" copper shall be extended to the building. The water
service shall be at least forty-eight inches deep to protect it from freezing.
There shall be installed on the curb stop a cast-iron curb box making the curb
stop accessible from the ground level.
   (f)    Installation of Water Heaters. Every hot water supply tank hereafter
installed, replaced or relocated shall be provided with an AGA or ADME approved
temperature and pressure relief valve. Every gas water heater hereafter
installed, replaced or relocated shall be provided with a vent flue connected
to a flue or chimney.
   (g)    Gas Lines. All gas lines shall be installed in accordance with rules
and regulations as issued by the East Ohio Gas Company.
   (h)    Water Distribution Pipes. Water lines shall be of sufficient size to
assure the proper functioning of all plumbing fixtures, but in no case shall it
be less than one-half inch in diameter. In a residence where twelve or more
plumbing fixtures are installed, water pipe trunk lines shall be at least
three-fourths inch in diameter with one-half inch branches to all fixtures.
Materials permitted in water lines shall be brass, or type "L" or "K" copper
pipe. Fittings shall be of brass or copper.
   (i)    Type of Test.
      (1)    Basement sewers shall be tested by the water test to the basement
floor level.
      (2)    Stacks, wastes and vents shall be tested by the water test through
the roof.
      (3)    All sewering constructed by any licensed plumber must be inspected
and approved by the Plumbing Inspector before covering the same.
   (Ord. 30-67. Passed 4-17-67; Ord. 54-88. Passed 9-26-88; Ord. 15-14. Passed
4-7-14.)
1305.02 EXCEPTIONS; USE OF PLASTIC PIPE AND FITTINGS.
   (a)    A.B.S. and P.V.C., Schedule 40, DWV, plastic pipe and fittings for
drain, waste and vent only, which meet the following standards, are hereby
permitted in all one-family, two- family and three-family dwellings in the
Municipality:
      A. B. S. (ACRYLONITRILE BUTADIENE STRYRENE)
ASTM-D-2661, CS-270-65 and FHA-HUD Use of Materials Bulletin No. 54 and FHA-MPS
Revision No. 31.
P. V. C.- (POLYVINYL CHLORIDE)
ASTM-D-2665, CS-272-65 and FHA-MPS Revision No. 31.
   (b)    That the use of such plastic pipe and fittings shall be subject to
the following conditions:
      (1)    All pieces of the pipe and fittings shall be plainly marked with
the name of the manufacturer, commercial standards and other identification
symbol.
      (2)    The solvent cement shall meet standards as specified in CS-270-65
and CS- 272-65, and applied and used in accordance with the manufacturer's
specifications; and adequate time must be allowed for final setting according
to the ambient temperature.
      (3)    A.B.S. and P.V.C., DWV pipe and fittings shall bear the NSF, DWV
symbol. (Ord. 33-70. Passed 5-4-70; Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1305.99 PENALTY.
   (a)    Penalty. Any user who is found to have violated an order of Council
or who has failed to comply with any provision of this chapter and the orders,
rules, regulations and permits issued hereunder, shall be fined. At least a
five hundred dollars ($500.00) fine is mandatory under this section. Each day
during which the violation occurs shall constitute a separate offense.
   (b)    Costs of Damage. Any user violating any of the provisions of this
chapter, or who causes damage or other impairment to the City's water and/or
wastewater system shall become liable for any expense, loss or damage caused by
the violation. The Director of Public Service may add to the user's charges and
fees, the costs assessed for any cleaning, repair or replacement work caused by
the violation. Refusal to pay the assessed costs shall constitute a violation
of this chapter.
   (c)   Falsifying Information. Any person who knowingly makes any false
statements, representation or certification in any application, record, report,
plan or other document filed or required to be maintained pursuant to this
chapter or who falsifies, tampers with or knowingly renders inaccurate any
monitoring or metering device or method required under this chapter shall be
guilty of a misdemeanor of the first degree.
(Ord. 54-88. Passed 9-26-88; Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)

1311.01 SCOPE AND INTENT.
   The provisions of this chapter shall apply to and govern plumbing as defined
in this chapter, including the practice, materials and fixtures used in the
installation, maintenance, repairs, extension and alterations of all piping,
fixtures, appliances and appurtenances in connection with any of the following:
sanitary drainage or storm drainage facilities, the venting systems, the public
or private water supply systems and the gas piping systems within or adjacent
to any building, structure or conveyance; also, the practices and materials
used in the installation, maintenance, repairs, extension or alteration of
systems conveying storm water, liquid wastes, sewage or water supply from any
premises to their connections with points of public disposal or other
authorized terminals. Plumbing further includes the installation of water
softeners, water heaters, food grinders, laundry and dishwashing machines, and
all other plumbing-connected appliances. (Ord. 31-67. Passed 4-17-67.)
1311.02 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter, certain terms are defined as follows:
   (a)    "Plumbing contractor" means a person, firm or corporation engaged in
the installation of plumbing in any building connected to the sewer and/or
water services of the City, under written or verbal contract with the owner,
lessee, contractor or person in control of the building.
   (b)    "Journeyman plumber" means a person who has been employed at his
trade or plumbing for a minimum of five years, either in the employ or under
the supervision of a plumbing contractor, and pursues his trade in the employ
of a plumbing contractor.
   A journeyman plumber is a person who is registered and the legal possessor
of a registration card of competency, as provided in this chapter, which
qualifies him to supervise installation, install, alter and/or repair plumbing
and drainage systems or parts thereof, as an employee. The journeyman plumber's
registration card does not qualify him to enter into contracts or agreements to
install or furnish plumbing materials and supplies.
   All journeyman plumbers shall register at the offices of the Director of
Public Service and shall pay a yearly fee of fifteen dollars ($15.00). Only
registered journeyman plumbers shall be permitted to install plumbing under the
supervision of a registered master plumber.
   (c)    "Plumbing apprentice" means a person who becomes engaged in learning
the plumbing trade by working under the direct supervision of a registered
journeyman plumber and in the employ of a plumbing contractor, in the
installation, maintenance and repair of plumbing.
Each apprentice plumber shall register at the offices of the Director of Public
Service and shall pay a fee of one dollar ($1.00) per year.
   (d)    "Registration Type No. 1 or unlimited or master plumbing
registration" entitles the holder to engage in all types of plumbing, water
line, and sanitary and storm sewer construction, including the installation of
any equipment required by these.
   (e)    "Registration Type No. 2 or limited plumbing registration" permits
the holder to install all types of storm or sanitary sewers, including manholes
and package or custom-built disposal tanks, and City or private water lines.
All work must terminate at least five feet from the exterior of any building
wall.
      (Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1311.03 REGISTRATION REQUIRED.
   (a)    No person or corporation shall engage in the business of contracting
plumbing in the City, until he shall first registers as provided in this
chapter.
   (b)    No person shall do the work of installing plumbing in a building or
residence or pursue the trade of a journeyman plumber in the City, without
first being registered as provided in this chapter, unless authorized under
Section
1311.09.
(Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1311.04 SPECIAL REGISTRATION; SCOPE, APPLICATION, FEE AND BOARD.
   (a)   Any person, firm or corporation who engages in the installation of
heating, air conditioning or refrigeration units and equipment or dealers and
installers of appliances shall not be required to hold either Registration Type
No. 1 or Registration Type No. 2 but shall be the holder of a special
registration to be issued by the Director of Public Service upon proper
application, as hereinafter set forth.
                  
   (b)   The National Electric Code, Plumbing Code, National Building Code and
all State Building Codes and amendments shall apply to special registration
holders in the specific area of material and installation practices. No special
registration holder is permitted to go beyond the energy source or to tap a
sewer line. Each registration holder can work only in his particular field,
unless qualified to work at any of the other trades of air conditioning,
refrigeration, heating and appliances, and which will be so noted on the
registration.
   (c)   Any person, firm or corporation performing work as a heating, air
conditioning or refrigeration contractor or as a dealer and installer of
appliances at the time this section is enacted (October 16, 1967) shall be
entitled to a special registration upon payment of the proper registration fee,
provided that the person, firm or corporation registers with the section within
thirty days after its enactment.
   (d)   Before a special Contractor's registration is issued, the applicant
shall be required to pay an annual fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) and to post a
bond as provided in Section
1311.05 (i). Registrations issued after April 1 of each year shall require a
fee of three-fourths the annual fee; after July 1 of each year, one-half the
annual fee, and after October 1 of each year, one-fourth the annual fee. Such
registration may be renewed each year upon the payment of the annual fee of
fifty dollars ($50.00) payable on or before January 15 of each year, together
with the posting of a new bond as required in Section
1311.05(i).
   (e)    A journeyman in the field covered by the special registration shall
pay an annual fee of ten dollars ($10.00) for each year all without proration
of the fee.
   (f)   Certificate Fees. The certificate fee for the installation of the
equipment under a special registration (HVAC) for new construction only is:

(Ord. 26-19. Passed 5-6-19.)
1311.05 PLUMBING REGISTRATION APPLICATION; FEE; BOND.
   (a)    Application; Plumbing Contractor. Application for a plumbing
contractor's registration shall be filled out and signed by the applicant on
forms prescribed by the Director of Public Service or Building and zoning codes
administrator and shall contain such information as required for the purpose of
fulfilling the objects and purposes of this chapter.
   (b)   Application; Partnership or Corporation. Application for a
registration by a partnership shall be signed by a partner and that of a
corporation by an officer of such corporation. Application forms shall be
prescribed by the Director of Public Service.
   (c)   (EDITOR'S NOTE: Former subsection (c) hereof was repealed by Ordinance
14-10.)
   (d)   Registration Fee. Registrations shall be issued annually and shall be
renewed on or before January 15 of each year.
      (1)   Applicant. Before a registration is issued, the applicant shall pay
the City an annual fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) per year for a Type No. 1
Registration or thirty-five dollars ($35.00) per year for a Type No. 2
Registration. Registrations issued after April 1 of each year, shall require a
fee of three-fourths the annual fee; after July 1 of each year, one-half the
annual fee, and after October 1 of each year, one-fourth the annual fee.
      (2)   Renewal. A registration may be renewed each year upon the payment
of an annual fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) for Type No. 1 Registration and an
annual fee of thirty-five dollars ($35.00) for Type No. 2 Registration, payable
on or before January 15 of each year.
   (e)   Journeyman Plumber's Registration. 
      (1)   Application.  An application for journeyman plumber's registration
shall be filled out by the applicant on forms prescribed by the Building and
Zoning Codes Administrator, shall contain such information as may be required
by the rules and regulations of such Department and shall be accompanied by a
fee of ten dollars ($10.00) to cover the cost of the registration.
      (2)   Renewal. Registration may be renewed each year upon the payment of
the annual fee of fifteen dollars ($15.00), payable on or before January 15 of
each year.
   (f)   Registered Plumbing Contractor. Any person, firm or corporation
holding a registration as a plumbing contractor at the time this section is
enacted will not be required to apply for a new registration, providing that
the firm or person registers with the Director of Public Service within ninety
days after its enactment.
   (g)   Improper Use of Registration. No person who has obtained a plumbing
contractor's registration shall permit his name to be used by another person,
either for the purpose of obtaining certificates or for doing business or work
under the registration. Every registered person shall notify the Building and
zoning codes administrator of the address of his place of business, the name
under which such business is carried on and, in the event of a change give
immediate notice to the administrator.
   (h)   Responsibility. Plumbing contractors shall conform to and obey all
statutes, laws, ordinances, rules and regulations which have been or may
hereafter be enacted or adopted governing plumbing installations.
   (i)   Bond.
      (1)   Such applicant shall file a bond in the sum of five thousand
dollars ($5,000) with surety to the approval of the Mayor, the form of which
shall be approved by the City Solicitor and conditioned that the applicant will
save and keep the City harmless from all loss and damage that may arise from
negligence or failure to comply with the provisions of the City Plumbing Code
by such applicant or his agents and employees, in the event that such
registration is granted.
      (2)   A registered plumbing contractor shall file and keep in force and
effect a good and sufficient bond during each period of renewal of
registration, as described in subsection (i)(1) hereof. (Ord. 26-19. Passed 5-
6-19.)
1311.06 EXAMINATIONS. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
1311.06 was repealed by Ordinance 14-10.)
1311.07 BOARD OF PLUMBING EXAMINERS.
   (a)    Duties. It shall be the purpose and duty of the Board of Plumbing
Examiners to determine the competency of an applicant for a registration as a
journeyman plumber to install plumbing according to the City Plumbing Code and
the State Plumbing Code, in order to protect the health of the residents of
this City. The Board shall accomplish this by examining each applicant and
shall limit the scope of examination as prescribed in examination subjects.
   It shall also be the duty of such Board to revoke and/or cancel
registrations issued under the provisions of this chapter.
   (b)    Members. The Board of Plumbing Examiners shall consist of two
plumbing contractors holding registrations in the City, one journeyman plumber
registered in the City and the Building and Zoning Codes Administrator.
      (1)   The Mayor shall appoint the three members above mentioned; one for
a term of one year, and two for a term of two years.
      (2)   Upon the expiration of such original terms and thereafter, the
Mayor shall appoint successive members for a term of three years each. In case
of resignation, removal or disability, the Mayor shall fill the unexpired term
by appointment.
         (Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1311.08 REVOCATION AND TRANSFER OF REGISTRATION.
   (a)    Any registration issued hereunder may be revoked or cancelled at any
time by the Board of Examiners herein provided for, for any violation of the
laws of the State or the ordinances of the City, or for any failure,
immediately after notice, to change, repair and alter any work previously done
which is found in any respect defective or unlawful, so that it will conform to
such laws, ordinances and requirements.
   (b)    A record shall be kept by the Department of Public Service showing
the date, name of registrant, location in the City and owner or person in
control of property where any such work is performed contrary to legal
requirements. A written notice shall be immediately given to the registrant who
did or had the same done, and such registrant shall, immediately upon receipt
of such written notice, make such work conform to legal requirements. However,
if the registrant shall claim that the work or material set forth and stated in
such notice to be defective and unlawful, is not defective and is in strict
accord with the law and regulations, he shall, within twenty-four hours after
such notice is made, so notify in writing the Board of Examiners. The Board
shall thereupon have a re-inspection made by another or different inspector,
and if such registrant is dissatisfied with the report of the second inspector,
the Board shall upon written application of the registrant made within forty-
eight hours after the second notice, give the registrant a hearing. The
decision of the Board thereupon shall be final.
   (c)    No registration issued under the authority of this chapter shall be
transferable, and if the person who holds such registration ceases to be a
member of the partnership or business entity to which the registration is
granted, then the registration is revoked.
(Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1311.09 CERTIFICATE REQUIRED BEFORE WORK.
   (a)   No plumbing work shall be done in the City without a certificate first
being issued by the Director of Public Service, except in case of repairs or
leaks which may be done without a certificate. Application for certificates
shall be made in writing on a form prescribed by the Director and shall state
the name of the plumbing contractor or plumbing contracting firm which is to
make the plumbing installation; the name and address of the owner or owners of
the building or property in which the work is to be done; the street and number
of building or property in which the work is to be done; and the date the work
is likely to be commenced. No other plumbing contractor can use the same
certificate.
   (b)   A certificate shall not be issued to anyone other than a duly
registered master plumber or a bona fide owner of a single dwelling in which
the same is occupied by, or will be immediately occupied by the owner.
   (c)   A certificate, required by this chapter, may be issued to a bona fide
owner of a single-family dwelling, including the usual accessory buildings and
quarters used exclusively as the owner's dwelling, provided the owner will
personally purchase all materials and perform all labor to install the plumbing
work described in the certificate, and all work shall conform to the
requirements of the State Plumbing Code and the owner will permanently occupy
the dwelling.
   (d)   No registration is required for merely hooking up or connecting
automatic washers to existing plumbing facilities.
(Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1311.10 CERTIFICATE, SCHEDULE OF FEES.
   The certificate fee for the installation of the equipment for plumbing work
during new construction only is:
 
Residential  Single Family Dwelling Duplex Triplex
Flat Fee of: $20.00                 $30.00 $50.00
             Four Unit or More Dwellings or commercial buildings with total
Commercial   value of less than $1,000,000.00
             $100.00
             Commercial Buildings with an estimated value in excess of
             $1,000,000.00
             $200.00
   There shall be no fee for replacement work or repairs in existing
structures.
(Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1311.11 DUTIES OF INSPECTORS. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
1311.11 was repealed by Ordinance 14-10.)
1311.12 PERMIT AND INSPECTION EXCEPTION.
   There is hereby excepted from the provisions of Section
1311.09,
1311.10 and
1311.11, plumbing work for which the State of Ohio assumes jurisdiction,
requires permit or inspection fees and does conduct inspection pursuant to law
and the rules and regulation of the Ohio Department of Health, the Ohio Board
of Building Standards and the Ohio Plumbing Code. (Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1311.13 CONFLICT.
   In any case where any provisions of this chapter are found to be in conflict
with a provision of any City ordinance or code existing on the effective date
of these regulations, the provisions which establish the higher standard for
the promotion and protection of the health, safety and welfare of the people
shall prevail. In any case where a provision of this chapter is found to be in
conflict with a provision of any other ordinance or code, which establishes a
lower standard for the promotion and protection of the health, safety and
welfare of the people, the provision of this chapter shall be deemed to prevail
and such other ordinances or codes are hereby declared to be repealed to the
extent that they may be found in conflict with these regulations. (Ord. 15-14.
Passed 4-7-14.)
1311.14 VALIDITY; SEVERABILITY.
   If any section, subsection, paragraph, sentence, clause or phrase of this
chapter should be declared invalid for any reason whatsoever, such decision
shall not affect the remaining portions or sections of this chapter, which
shall remain in full force and effect, and to this end, the provisions of this
chapter are hereby declared to be severable.
(Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1311.15 CITY OF DOVER CONTRACTS.
   (a)    All plumbing contractors employed by the City shall hold a
registration issued by the City for all work performed thereunder.
   (b)    Where necessary, the Plumbing Board shall conduct the required tests
at times other than those regularly scheduled in order to accommodate the
contractor's compliance herewith. (Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1311.16 LIMITED JOURNEYMAN'S REGISTRATION.
   (a)    The City shall issue a Limited Journeyman's Registration without
examination to any Journeyman employed by a contractor engaged in a project
funded by State or Federal grants or loans. and which project is outside the
City's inspection jurisdiction provided that the following criteria are met:
      (1)    The Journeyman shall pay the appropriate registration fee.
      (2)   The Journeyman shall hold a valid registration which is currently
in effect and which was issued by a recognized licensing agency whose training
and testing and examination program is comparable to that of the City of Dover
as determined by the Board of Plumbing Examiners. For purposes of this section,
the Journeyman shall provide sufficient information with his application or
upon request to meet the requirements established herein.
      (3)    The contractor for whom the Journeyman is employed has obtained a
registration from the City.
   (b)    The registration issued shall terminate upon the completion of the
project for which the registration was granted. (Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1311.99 PENALTY.
   Any person, firm or corporation violating the provisions of this chapter
shall, upon conviction thereof, be fined not less than ten dollars ($10.00) nor
more than twenty-five dollars ($25.00) for the first offense, and not less than
twenty dollars ($20.00) nor more than one hundred dollars ($100.00) for the
second offense. Upon violation for the second time, the registration of such
person, firm or corporation shall not be granted for the period of three months
from the date of conviction. If such person, firm or corporation shall, after
again being granted a registration, violate these rules and regulations, he
shall, upon conviction, be fined not less than twenty dollars ($20.00) nor more
than one hundred dollars ($100.00), and at such time the registration of each
person, firm or corporation shall be revoked for the period of one year from
the date of conviction. (Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)

      Power to license electricians - see Ohio R.C. 715.27
      Power to regulate electricity equipment - see Ohio R.C. 715.27
      Light bills; collection places and agents - see S. & P. S.
         
931.01 et seq.
1313.01 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter, certain terms are defined as follows:
   (a)    "Electrical wiring" applies to all electrical wiring, conductors,
equipment and electrical devices used within buildings for the transmission of
electric current for light, heat, power, signaling or any other purpose
whatsoever within the City. However, the following is not considered as
electrical wiring, only in that registrations and certificates will not be
required: the replacement of fuses, lamps, wall switches, receptacles and
sockets; the attachment of portable appliances to existing outlets; the
repairing of appliances, motors and other devices when not attached to
permanent wiring, the wiring which is an integral part of machinery,
appliances, apparatus and vehicles, and other electrical wiring exempted in
this chapter.
   (b)    "Electrical contractor" includes any person, firm or corporation who
proceeds with or employs others for the installation, alteration, repair of or
additions to any electrical wiring within the City under contract, written or
verbal, expressed or implied, with the owner, lessee or contractor of any
building.
   (c)    "Registered electrician" includes any person engaged in, working at
or pursuing the trade of an electrician in the City, while in the employ of a
registered electrical contractor.
   (d)    "Apprentice electrician" includes any person who is in the employ of
a registered electrical contractor. A registered electrical contractor is
entitled to employ one apprentice electrician under his electrical contractor's
registration plus one additional apprentice electrician for each registered
electrician he employs.
   (e)    "Outlet" means a fixed point on a wiring system from which current
may be taken or each switch point, not in panels or on fixtures, or each ten
feet or fraction thereof of strip wiring.
   (f)    "Fixture" means a fixed device attached to the wiring system, having
one or more lamp holders. (Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1313.02 SCOPE, APPLICATION AND REGISTRATION .
   No person, firm or corporation, except as exempted in Section
 1313.03, shall engage in the installation, alteration, repair of or addition
to any electrical wiring within the City until such person, firm or corporation
has obtained a registration to do so from the Department of Public Service.
(Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1313.03 REGISTRATION EXEMPTIONS.
   (a)    No provision of this chapter shall be interpreted to require that the
bona fide owner and occupant of a single-family dwelling be registered, who
personally or with casual assistance, performs work upon the premises occupied
or to be occupied by the owner thereof as such owner's established residence.
Such owner shall be issued a certificate for such work providing he was
satisfactorily qualified through an oral test given by the Department of Public
Service, relating to such work. All such work shall be done in conformity with
the provisions of this chapter and no work shall be done unless all
certificates required by this chapter are obtained.
   (b)    No provision of this chapter shall be interpreted to apply to
manufacturers performing, in their own plant and with their own employees, work
covered hereby, nor to public utility companies operating under franchise or
the laws of the State, in the installation, maintenance, removal or repair of
the electrical wiring used in connection with their businesses. This exemption
includes all wires, cables, meters and accessories installed on the customer's
premises and owned by the local light and power company. However, the City
reserves the right to have inspected the electrical installation covered by
this subsection whenever the Department of Public Service feels that such
inspection would be in the best interest of the public's safety and welfare.
   (c)    No provision of this chapter shall be interpreted to require an
apprentice electrician to have a registration, take an examination or pay any
fee before engaging in the pursuit of his trade when he is in the employ and
under the direct supervision of a registered electrical contractor.
   (d)    Any person, firm or corporation who is the holder of a special
registration issued under Section
 1311.04 shall be exempt from the registration and bonding requirements of this
chapter.
(Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1313.04 QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED FOR APPLICATION OF ELECTRICAL JOURNEYMAN'S
REGISTRATION (REPEALED).
   EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
1313.04 was repealed by Ordinance 26-19.
1313.05 APPLICATION FOR ELECTRICAL CONTRACTOR'S REGISTRATION; BOND REQUIRED AND
REGISTRATION FEE REQUIRED.
   An application for an electrical contractor's registration shall be made in
writing in the name of the person, firm or corporation applying therefor, on
forms prescribed and provided by the Department of Public Service and shall
contain such information as is required by the rules and regulations of such
Department. If such application is made by an individual, it shall be signed by
such individual; if made by a partnership, it shall be signed by one of the
partners; and if made by a corporation, it shall be signed by one of the
officers of such corporation. Such application shall be accompanied by a bond,
to be held on file by the City, in the sum of five thousand dollars ($5,000)
with surety to the approval of the Mayor and the form of which shall be
approved by the City Solicitor and conditioned that the applicant will save and
keep the City harmless from all loss and damage that may arise from the
negligence of such applicant or his agents or employees and will conform to and
obey all statutes, laws, ordinances, rules and regulations which have been or
may hereafter be enacted or adopted respecting and governing or intended to
govern electrical work or the installation of electrical wiring, conductors and
equipment. The registration fee for an electrical journeyman shall be ten
dollars ($10.00). (Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1313.06 APPLICATION FOR JOURNEYMAN ELECTRICIAN'S REGISTRATION EXAM.(REPEALED)
   EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
1313.06 was repealed by Ordinance 26-19.
1313.07 BOARD OF ELECTRICAL EXAMINERS; MEMBERS, ORGANIZATION. (REPEALED)
   EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
1313.07 was repealed by Ordinance 26-19.
1313.08 POWERS AND DUTIES OF BOARD OF ELECTRICAL EXAMINERS. (REPEALED)
   EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
1313.08 was repealed by Ordinance 26-19.
1313.09 RECIPROCITY.
   Any journeyman electrician holding a current license issued in any of the
reciprocal licensing areas in the State of Ohio, may apply for a journeyman
electrician registration in Dover, Ohio, and upon payment of the proper
registration fee, shall automatically be issued a journeyman electrician
registration without the necessity of taking a written examination. It is
expressly understood that this reciprocal registration agreement shall apply to
only those areas within the State of Ohio, that grant reciprocity to journeyman
electricians from this Municipality. All journeyman electricians not holding a
current registration shall be required to take a written examination as
provided above. (Ord. 26-19. Passed 5-6-19.)
1313.10 REGISTRATION FEES.
   (a)   Before an electrical contractor's registration shall be issued, the
person, firm or corporation applying for such registration shall pay a fee
therefor at the rate of thirty-five dollars ($35.00) per year, and the
applicant for a registered electrician's registration shall pay a fee therefor
at the rate of ten dollars ($10.00) per year. Such rates are based on the
calendar year.
   (b)   Registrations issued after April 1 of each year shall require a fee of
three-fourths the annual fee; after July 1 of each year, one-half the annual
fee, and after October 1 of each year, one-fourth the annual fee.
(Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1313.11 REGISTRATION RENEWAL.
   An electrical contractor's registration can be renewed from year to year by
filing an application therefor in writing and paying an annual fee of thirty-
five dollars ($35.00) and furnishing a new bond conditioned and subject to
approval as provided in Section
1313.05. A registered electrician's registration can be renewed from year to
year by filing an application therefor in writing and paying an annual fee of
ten dollars ($10.00). Such registration shall be granted upon payment of the
full annual fee without examination. The failure of any electrical contractor
or registered electrician to pay such annual fee within a period of sixty days
from the date of expiration of the former registration shall automatically
constitute a revocation of the registration and the electrical contractor and
registered electrician shall be required to re-register. All registrations and
renewals of the same shall expire on December 31 of each year. (Ord. 15- 14.
Passed 4-7-14.)
1313.12 REGISTRATION MAY BE REVOKED.
   Any registration issued hereunder may be revoked and cancelled at any time
by the Board of Electrical Examiners for the reasons listed in Section
1313.08. A record shall be kept by the Building and Zoning Codes Administrator
showing the date, name of registrant, location in the City and the owner or
person in control of the property where any work is performed contrary to this
chapter. A written notice shall be immediately given to the registrant who did
or had the same done, and such registrant shall immediately upon receipt of
such written notice make such work conform to the provisions of this chapter.
If such registrant shall claim that the work and material set forth and stated
in such notice to be defective and in violation of this chapter, is not
defective and is in strict accord with the provisions of this chapter, and he
shall, within twenty-four hours after such notice is given, notify, in writing,
the Board, such Board shall thereupon have a re-inspection made by the
inspector and if the registrant is satisfied with the report of such re-
inspection, the Board shall upon written application of the registrant, made
within forty-eight hours thereafter, give the registrant a hearing. The
decision of the Board shall be final. When a registration has been revoked or
cancelled by the Board, the holder of such revoked or cancelled registration
may, after a period of one year, apply for a new registration subject to the
provisions of Sections
1313.05 to
1313.09, inclusive.
(Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1313.13 REGISTRATION NOT TRANSFERABLE .
   No registration issued under the authority of this chapter shall be
transferable, and if the registrant ceases to be a member of the firm or
corporation to which the registration is granted or ceases to be an officer of
the firm or corporation to which the registration is granted, then the
electrical contractor's registration shall be revoked. Should any electrical
contractor's registration be revoked for the above cause then the registrant
shall be entitled to a refund of a prorated amount of the registration fee for
the remainder of the calendar year, but nothing herein contained shall be
construed to mean that there shall be any refund of any registration fee or any
part thereof when the registration is revoked for any cause other than
specifically set forth in this section. (Ord. 15- 14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1313.14 CERTIFICATE REQUIRED BEFORE WORK.
   No electrical wiring shall be installed, altered or repaired in the City,
without first obtaining a certificate to do so from the Department of Public
Service. Electrical certificates shall be issued only to the holder of an
electrical contractor's registration or the bona fide owner of a single-family
residence, as permitted in Section
1313.03(a). No certificate shall be required for any industrial work except
that installed in new structures. Applications for such certificate shall be
made in writing on forms prescribed and provided by the Department of Public
Service. Such application shall state the name of the person, firm or
corporation that is to do the electrical work, the names and addresses of the
owner or owners of the building or property in which the work is to be done and
when such work is likely to be commenced. When requested by the Department, the
applicant for a certificate shall furnish to the same a plan and specification
completely describing the work to be installed before a certificate shall be
issued. Such plan and specification shall remain on file in the Department.
(Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)

   The certificate fee for the installation of the equipment for electrical
work during new construction only is:
 
Residential  Single Family Dwelling Duplex Triplex

   Electric Service and Service Upgrades to existing buildings:

   There is hereby excepted from the provisions of Section
1313.14 and
1313.15, electrical work for which the State of Ohio assumes jurisdiction,
requires permit and inspection fees, and does conduct inspections pursuant to

(Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1313.18 ENFORCING AGENT.
   It shall be the duty of the Building and Zoning Codes Administrator and his
duly appointed assistants to enforce all the provisions of this chapter. If a
condition exists or arises which is not specifically provided for herein, the
Building and Zoning Codes Administrator shall prescribe the requirements
necessary to make such work conform to the intent and purpose hereof so that,
when installed, such electrical work shall be safe and not hazardous to person
or property. (Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1313.19 RESERVED FOR FUTURE LEGISLATION.
1313.20 RECORDS OF CERTIFICATES AND INSPECTIONS.
   The Department of Public Service shall keep complete records of all
certificates issued and inspections made and other official work performed
under the provisions of this chapter. Such records shall be kept for a period
of at least five years.
(Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1313.21 RIGHT OF ACCESS TO BUILDINGS.
   (a)   The Building and Zoning Codes Administrator or his assistants shall
have the right of entry at reasonable times and reasonable hours into all
structures, buildings and dwellings in the City, wherein there is reasonable
ground to believe that there is a violation of the standards or provisions of
this chapter.
   (b)   Where the person lawfully in occupancy of such premises withholds his
assent thereto, such right of entry and inspection can be exercised only under
authority of a search warrant issued by a court of competent jurisdiction as
provided by law. No warrant shall be issued except upon a sworn complaint, in
ordinary and concise language, based upon knowledge and belief which satisfies
the court that there is reasonable ground to believe that a violation exists.
(Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1313.22 CONSTRUCTION CONFORMITY WITH REGULATIONS. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
 1313.22 was repealed by Ordinance 15-14.)
1313.23 CONFLICT.
   In any case where any provisions of this chapter are found to be in conflict
with a provision of any City ordinance or code existing on the effective date
of these regulations, the provisions which establish the higher standard for
the promotion and protection of the health, safety and welfare of the people
shall prevail. In any case where a provision of this chapter is found to be in
conflict with a provision of any other ordinance or code which establishes a
lower standard for the promotion and protection of the health, safety and
welfare of the people, the provision of this chapter shall be deemed to
prevail, and such other ordinances or codes are hereby declared to be repealed
to the extent that they may be found in conflict with these regulations. (Ord.
15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1313.24 VALIDITY; SEVERABILITY.
   If any section, subsection, paragraph, sentence, clause or phrase of this
chapter should be declared invalid for any reason whatsoever, such decision
shall not effect the remaining portion of this chapter which shall remain in
full force and effect, and to this end, the provisions of this chapter are
hereby declared to be severable.
(Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)
1313.99 PENALTY.
   Any person, firm, corporation, owner or agent who violates or causes others
to violate any of the provisions of this chapter or fails to comply with any of
the requirements of this chapter and the Department of Public Service of the
City, is guilty of a minor misdemeanor. Each day's failure to comply with any
such provision shall constitute a separate violation. (Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-
14.)
 
CHAPTER 1315
Roofers
1315.01   Registration required; fee; insurance.
   1315.01 REGISTRATION REQUIRED; FEE; INSURANCE.
   (a)   No person shall engage in the business of repairing, replacing,
removing or improving roofs upon residential, commercial, or industrial
structures within the City without first having obtained a registration, which
registration shall be issued according to the following standards:
      (1)   Such registration shall be issued upon the presentation of evidence
satisfactory to the Service Director, that the applicant is qualified and has
the experience and training to engage in roofing work; and provided that before
any registration shall be issued, each applicant shall first file evidence of
possession of liability insurance in the minimum amounts of three hundred
thousand dollars ($300,000) for bodily injury or death and one hundred thousand
dollars ($100,000) property damage indemnifying the City or any person injured
or damaged resulting from the pursuit of such endeavor as herein described.
      (2)   A fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) shall be charged for each such
registration, giving such registrant the right to engage in the business if
repairing, replacing, removing or improving roofs upon residential, commercial,
or industrial structures within the City, for a period of one year next
following the issuance of such registration.
      (3)   The Service Director is authorized to revoke a registration at any
time upon proof satisfactory to him that the person holding such registration
is violating the provisions of this section; or is engaged in practicing fraud
upon any person for whom he is performing roofing work as described herein.
   (b)   For purposes of this section, the business of repairing, replacing,
removing, or improving roofs shall include all such work on roofing shingles,
underlayment, roof coating, trusses, and roof vents.
(Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14.)

CHAPTER 1322
Fences
1322.01   Requirements.
CROSS REFERENCES
Barb wire or electric - see GEN. OFF.
521.07
   1322.01 REQUIREMENTS.
   (a)    Fences up to three feet in height are permitted in yards fronting on
the public street. The building line of the house foundation shall be
considered as the point from which a fence may extend toward a front property
line not to exceed three feet in height, and on a corner lot a fence shall not
protrude beyond the building line of a structure in a side yard in excess of
three feet. Fences in a front yard must stay a minimum of twelve inches back
from a sidewalk, if present. These same screening devices up to six feet in
height are permitted in the remaining yards. In the event that a request is
made to install a fence in excess of three feet on a corner lot that abuts a
rear alley, it shall be the discretion of the Building and Zoning Codes
Administrator to determine where the fence shall be located and at what height
it shall be allowed in order to create a reasonable visibility for vehicular
traffic where two right of ways intersect. No fence shall be permitted to be
erected in a City easement or in a right of way. Chain link fencing shall only
be permitted in the side and rear yards in residential districts. It's the
responsibility of the property owner to ensure that any fence is installed
within the confines of their property. In no case shall a fence prevent an
adjacent property owner from performing maintenance to any structure(s) on
their property. Fences shall present a finished side to the adjoining property,
which side shall not be adorned with signs, graphics or paintings of any kind.
Any fence that is installed in the City shall be suitable and designed for the
intended purpose by the manufacturer and shall not be made of makeshift
materials. Construction site or snow fences are permitted only on construction
sites during the period of work performed at that location. All fences erected
in the City of Dover require a twenty-five dollars ($25.00) zoning certificate
fee, accompanied by a drawing and filed with the City of Dover Building and
Zoning Administrator. (Ord. 41-22. Passed 9-6-22.)
   (b)   Any private swimming pool that is defined in Section
1143.09 Private Swimming Pools shall adhere to the fencing provision under
Section
1143.09(b)(3). The swimming pool, or the entire property on which it is
located, shall be walled or fenced to prevent uncontrolled access by young
children from the street or from adjacent properties. Such fence or wall shall
be not less than four feet in height and maintained in good condition, with a
gate and lock. Alternately, the swimming pool may be constructed or situated in
such a way that there is no less than a four foot barrier, deck, rigid side or
other construction that is equivalent to a fence or barrier that has a four
foot height.
   (c)   No person shall erect or maintain any fence charged with electric
current, or maintain a barbed wire fence which abuts or is adjacent to any
public street or sidewalk. Injurious materials such as barbed wire or spiked
fences are not permitted, except in the placement and use of not more than
three strands of barbed wire on top of a fence other than a barbed wire fence,
provided such strands are not less than seventy-two inches from the ground.
Such fence may only be located in a Commercial (B) or Industrial (M) zoned
district. Whoever violates this section is guilty of a minor misdemeanor.
Penalty, see
501.99.
   (d)   Off-street parking areas for more than ten vehicles shall be
effectively screened on each side which adjoins or faces premises situated in
any residential zoned district, or institutional premises by a masonry wall or
solid fence of acceptable design. Such wall or fence shall not be less than
four feet or more than six feet in height and shall be maintained in good
condition without any advertising thereon.
   (e)   Auto and metal salvage operations shall be effectively screened on all
sides by means of walls or fences. Walls or fences shall be a minimum of six
feet in height and a maximum of eight feet in height with no advertising
thereon and properly maintained. Fences are permitted to have barbed wire
across the top for security purposes in the M-2 zoned (General Industrial)
districts. (Ord. 35-17. Passed 11-20-17.)
CHAPTER 1323
Soil Removal and Excavations
1323.01   Permit required; exceptions.
1323.02   Application for permit.
1323.03   Duty of Director of Public Service and Council.
1323.04   Bond required.
1323.05   Fee for soil removal permit.
1323.06   Drainage; nuisances prohibited.
1323.07   Erosion control.
1323.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
         Street openings by the City - see Ohio R.C. 723.02
         Excavation liability - see Ohio R.C. 723.49 et seq.
         Street opening charges - see S. & P.S.
923.03
   1323.01 PERMIT REQUIRED; EXCEPTIONS.
   No person, corporation, partnership or association and every servant or
agent of any corporation, partnership, association or individual, shall strip
and remove, or cause or permit the stripping and removal of any topsoil or
loam, or the removal of any soil, sand, gravel or other deposits under topsoil,
from any land located in the City, except such removal so far as necessary for
the erection, construction or alteration of buildings or the installation of
sidewalks or driveways, on the land from which such removal is made, unless he
is the holder of or in conformance with, a permit to do so, issued pursuant to
the provisions of this chapter.
(Ord. 10-62. Passed 2-19-62.)
   1323.02 APPLICATION FOR PERMIT.
   Any person desiring a permit to remove topsoil or loam, or to remove sand,
gravel or other deposits under topsoil, shall file with the Director of Public
Service a written application therefor. The application shall contain the
following information:
   (a)   The full name and address of the applicant; if the application is by a
partnership, the name and address of each of the partners; if the application
is by a corporation, the names of its principal officers;
   (b)   The description of the land from which the topsoil or loam is to be
stripped, or from which the soil, sand, gravel or other deposit is to be
removed, specifying the material and quantity desired to be removed;
   (c)   If the applicant is not the owner of the land described, then the name
and address of the owner must be stated and the owner’s written consent to the
work proposed must be attached to the application;
   (d)   The method of stripping and removal to be employed;
   (e)    The time within which the work will be commenced and completed;
    (f)   The type of backfilling, reseeding or replanting proposed for the
land;
    (g)    The depth of the topsoil now on the property, the amount proposed to
be removed and the amount to remain;
    (h)    The method of drainage to be used during the operation and after its
completion, and the topography of the land after removal;
   (i)    The ultimate proposed use of the land after the removal of the
topsoil, loam, sand, gravel or other deposits;
    (j)    That the applicant is capable of, and will furnish a performance
bond in the amount of five hundred dollars ($500.00) for each acre or fraction
thereof, included in the permit; and
    (k)    Such other information as the Director of Public Service shall deem
necessary.
       (Ord. 10-62. Passed 2-19-62.)
 
   1323.03 DUTY OF DIRECTOR OF PUBLIC SERVICE AND COUNCIL.
    The Director of Public Service shall investigate the statements contained
in the application and shall report the application and his findings to
Council. Council shall set a date for a hearing upon the application and shall
notify the applicant of the date. If, after a hearing, Council determines that
the granting of the application will not adversely affect the public welfare,
health, safety and convenience, it shall grant the application subject to
conditions relating to the method of stripping and/or removal, the term of the
permit and, in case of stripping, the amount of topsoil or loam to be left on
the land, which shall not be less than three inches, the reseeding or
replanting, the drainage or topography, and such other conditions as Council
may deem necessary for the protection of public interest, health, safety and
welfare. Any conditions imposed by Council shall remain a part of the permit
and constitute limitations thereon. Council shall, by a majority vote, act on
the application, subject to the limitations set forth in this chapter.
(Ord. 10-62. Passed 2-19-62.)
   1323.04 BOND REQUIRED.
   Upon the granting of the application, the Director of Public Service shall
be instructed to issue the permit, containing the conditions imposed upon it,
if any, and the permit shall be issued to the applicant upon posting of a bond
in favor of the City, conditioned upon the performance of the permit in
accordance with its terms. The bond shall be signed by the applicant, as
principal, and a surety company or two good and sufficient sureties
satisfactory to the Mayor. The bond shall be in the amount of five hundred
dollars ($500.00) for each acre, or fraction thereof, of property under the
permit. The bond shall be filed with the Mayor.
(Ord. 10-62. Passed 2-19-62.)
   1323.05 FEE FOR SOIL REMOVAL PERMIT.
   A fee of ten dollars ($10.00) for each acre or a fraction thereof to be
stripped or excavated shall be charged for such permit, which shall be paid
before the issuance of such permit. The minimum fee shall be ten dollars
($10.00). (Ord. 10-62. Passed 2-19-62.)
   1323.06 DRAINAGE; NUISANCES PROHIBITED.
   (a)   Whenever the surface of a lot or plot or any land in the City is
excavated, filled or graded, positive drainage shall be provided so that a
nuisance will not be created. Catch basins or properly connected underdrains
shall be installed, or other approved provisions made where water may pocket to
preclude the accumulation of surface water. Surface water shall not be drained
onto adjacent properties not in the same ownership without written permission
from the owner of the adjacent property, and existing natural ground drainage
of the ground area surrounding the lot or plot excavated, filled or graded
shall not be impeded.
   (b)    No condition shall be created nor any existing condition maintained
whereby there will be upon any lot, plot or land in the City excavations,
depressions, pits, holes, gullies or similar depressions which may accumulate
and retain surface water and which may become a public hazard or nuisance. Any
such condition shall be promptly abated and protected by filling or by
providing positive drainage and, where necessary, by the erection of a
barricade or fence. (Ord. 10-62. Passed 2-19-62.)
   1323.07 EROSION CONTROL.
   (a)    Whenever the surface of a lot or plot or any land in the City is
excavated, filled, graded or stripped of its vegetation, positive erosion
control shall be provided by erecting a barricade of straw bales in such a
manner that no soil or debris escapes from the lot, plot or land onto the
streets or into the City storm sewer system.
   (b)    If soil or debris escapes into the City storm sewer system, the
entity responsible for such, which is deemed to be the entity who received a
permit for the related construction which caused the need for erosion control,
shall immediately remove all soil or debris from the streets or storm sewers.
Failure to remove such soil and debris will cause the City to have the soil and
debris removed from the streets and/or storm sewers. The cost of the removal
shall then be invoiced to the entity who received a permit for the related
construction work. Failure to pay the removal costs will cause the City to
place such costs on the County Property Tax Duplicate for collection. (Ord. 12-
91. Passed 4-15-91.)
   1323.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates or disregards any of the provisions of this chapter, and
whoever assists in the committing of any violation, shall, for each and every
violation or noncompliance, be guilty of a minor misdemeanor.
   Each day the violation continues, shall constitute a separate offense.
(Ord. 10-62. Passed 2-19-62; amending Ord. 80-74. Passed 10-21-74.)
CHAPTER 1324
Building Elevations
1324.01    First floor height.
CROSS REFERENCES
      Height and area requirements - see P. & Z. Ch.
1151
   1324.01 FIRST FLOOR HEIGHT.
   (a)    Any person, corporation, partnership or association constructing or
altering a building or an addition to a building shall establish the first
floor level of the building at a minimum height above the back of the existing
sidewalk, or planned sidewalk if no walk exists, conforming to the following
requirements:
      (1)    Front yard requirement of zero feet - first floor height shall be
the same as back of sidewalk height.
      (2)    Front yard requirement between zero feet and thirty feet - first
floor height shall increase one inch in height for each foot the building is
set back of the property side of the sidewalk.
      (3)    Front yard requirement beyond thirty feet - the first floor height
shall be thirty inches in height plus one-fourth of an inch in height for each
foot over thirty feet that the building is set back of the property side of the
sidewalk.
   (b)    Any person, corporation, partnership or association constructing or
altering a building or an addition to a building, which building is considered
an accessory building to the principal building occupying the premises, like a
garage or storage building, shall establish the first floor of the accessory
building in such a manner that positive drainage is maintained from the
building or adjacent street, alley or natural draining surfaces.
   (c)    The Planning Commission shall, in accordance with its rules of
procedure, have authority to investigate and grant variances of any of the
provisions contained in this chapter in the event of hardship or impossibility
of compliance with the specific terms hereof.
(Ord. 13-91. Passed 4-5-91.)
CHAPTER 1325
Outdoor Swimming Pools
1325.01    Definition.
1325.02   Compliance required.
1325.03   Distance between pool and property lines. (Repealed)
1325.04   Fence required. (Repealed)
1325.05   Permit required; fee.
1325.06   Plot plan and pool specifications required.
1325.07   Appeal on refusal to issue permit.
1325.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
      Power to regulate fences - see Ohio R.C. 715.27
      Private, community and club swimming pools - see P. & Z.
1143.09,
1143.10
   1325.01 DEFINITION.
   For the purposes of this chapter, “outdoor swimming pool” means any
artificial water pool of steel, masonry, concrete, aluminum or plastic
construction, located out of doors, which has a water surface area of 200
square feet or more and a depth at any point of more than eighteen inches.
(Ord. 53-10. Passed 12-20-10.)
   1325.02 COMPLIANCE REQUIRED.
   No outdoor swimming pool which is not enclosed in a permanent building or
like structure shall be constructed or maintained in the Municipality unless
and until the requirements and conditions of Sections
1325.03 to
1325.07 are complied with.
(Ord. 48-62. Passed 6-18-62.)
   1325.03 DISTANCE BETWEEN POOL AND PROPERTY LINES. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
1325.03 was repealed by Ordinance 02-08, passed February 18, 2008.)
   1325.04 FENCE REQUIRED. (REPEALED)
   EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
1325.04 was repealed by Ordinance 35-17.
   1325.05 PERMIT REQUIRED; FEE.
   No pool regulated by this chapter shall be hereinafter constructed or
established unless a permit to do so is first obtained from the Director of
Public Service.
   A fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) shall be charged for the issuance thereof.
(Ord. 53-10. Passed 12-20-10.)
   1325.06 PLOT PLAN AND POOL SPECIFICATIONS REQUIRED.
   Before a swimming pool permit is issued, a plot plan shall be submitted
showing the location of the swimming pool with respect to lot lines and
buildings. There shall also be submitted a list of materials and a description
of the method of construction and the dimensions of the pool. The lot area
covered by an “outdoor swimming pool” shall apply to the lot area restrictions
established in Chapter
1151. (Ord. 64-01. Passed 12-17-01.)
   1325.07 APPEAL ON REFUSAL TO ISSUE PERMIT.
   (a)   Except as provided in subsection (b), below, a refusal by the Director
of Public Service to issue a permit, as provided in Section
1325.05, may be appealed in writing within ten days after such refusal to the
Planning Commission, as provided for in other cases of appeals thereto. The
Commission shall then, in accordance with its rules of procedure, investigate
such application and refusal, and render final judgment based upon whether, in
its opinion, the provisions of this chapter have been and will be complied
with.
   (b)   In the event that the Director of Public Service refuses to issue such
permit due in whole or in part to a violation of the lot area restrictions
established in Chapter
1151, then the applicant shall appeal said decision as it relates to Chapter
1151 to the Board of Zoning Appeals pursuant to the process established by
Chapter
1127. Said appeal shall be in addition to the appeal referenced in subsection
(a), above, as it relates to any other reasons for refusal.
(Ord. 64-01. Passed 12-17-01.)
   1325.99 PENALTY.
   (a)    Whoever violates this chapter shall be deemed guilty of a minor
misdemeanor. Each day of violation shall constitute a separate offense.
   (b)    In addition to the penalty above provided, the Director of Public
Service is hereby authorized and directed to turn off the water supply to any
consumer who is violating any of the provisions of this chapter, and the same
shall not be turned on again until the provisions of this chapter are complied
with.
(Ord. 48-62. Passed 6-18-62; amending Ord. 80-74. Passed 10-21-74.)

         collection - see S. & P. S.
929.02
1327.01 MINIMUM STANDARDS FOR BASIC EQUIPMENT AND FACILITIES.
   No person shall occupy as tenant or as owner-occupant, or let to another for
occupancy any dwelling or dwelling unit for the purpose of living, sleeping,
cooking or eating therein, which does not comply with the following
requirements:
   (a)    Required Facilities. Every dwelling containing dwelling units shall
contain the following facilities, all properly installed to approved water and
sewer systems:
      (1)    Kitchen sink;
      (2)    Flush water closet;
      (3)    Lavatory basin, and
      (4)    Bathtub or shower.
   (Facilities required in subsections (a)(2) and (4) above shall be installed
in such a way as to afford privacy.)
   (b)    Water Line Connections. Every kitchen sink, lavatory basin and
bathtub or shower required by this Code shall be properly connected with both
hot and cold water lines. The hot water lines shall be properly connected with
supplied water heating facilities which are capable of heating water to such a
temperature as to permit an adequate amount of water to be drawn at every hot
water faucet of not less than 120 degrees Fahrenheit, even when the heating
plant facilities required by this Code are not in operation.
   (c)    Garbage and Rubbish Collection. Every dwelling unit shall have
adequate garbage and rubbish disposal facilities, the type and location of
which are approved by the Health Commissioner or his duly authorized
representative.
   (d)    Egress. Every dwelling unit shall have safe, unobstructed means of
egress leading to safe and open space at ground level as defined by the
National Building Code. For residential living units in any one structure, in
excess of three, the provisions of the Ohio Building Code, as amended, shall
apply in its entirety. (Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14; Ord. 9-21. Passed 4-5-21.)
1327.02 MINIMUM SPACE, USE AND LOCATION REQUIREMENTS.
   No person shall occupy as tenant or as owner-occupant or let to another for
occupancy any dwelling or dwelling unit, for the purpose of living, sleeping,
cooking or eating therein, which does not comply with the following
requirements:
   (a)    Space.
      (1)    Calculation of floor space. Floor area shall be calculated on the
basis of habitable room area. However, closet area and hall area within the
dwelling unit, where provided, may count for not more than five percent of the
required habitable floor space. At least one-half of the floor area of every
habitable room shall have a ceiling height of at least seven feet. The floor
area of that part of any room where ceiling height is less than five feet shall
not be considered as part of the floor area in computing the total floor area
of the room for the purpose of determining the maximum permissible occupancy
thereof.
      (2)    Habitable floor space. 
         A.    Every dwelling unit shall contain at least 150 square feet of
floor space for the first occupant thereof and at least 100 additional square
feet of floor space for each additional occupant.
         B.    In every dwelling unit of two or more rooms, every room occupied
for sleeping purposes by one occupant shall contain at least seventy square
feet of floor space for the first occupant and every room occupied for sleeping
purposes by more than one occupant shall contain at least fifty square feet of
floor space for each occupant thereof.
   (b)    Arrangement of Habitable Rooms. No dwelling or dwelling unit
containing two or more sleeping rooms shall have such room arrangement that
access to a bathroom or flush water closet compartment intended for use by
occupants of more than one sleeping room can be had only by going through
another sleeping room. Nor shall room arrangements be such that access to a
sleeping room, a bathroom or flush water closet compartment. This requirement
can be waived at the discretion of the Coordinator.
   (c)    Location of Dwelling Units; Basement or Cellar. No basement or cellar
shall be used for living purposes unless:
      (1)    The floors and walls are substantially watertight.
      (2)    All requirements of this Code are met as regards to light, heat,
ventilation and ceiling height.
      (3)    Nonliving space in the basement is permanently separated from all
habitable space.
         (Ord. 15-14. Passed 4-7-14; Ord. 9-21. Passed 4-5-21.)
